missing_from_theories.why_important: This describes how newcomers gradually move from the periphery to core participation through legitimate but limited involvement. The current model lacks the gradual progression mechanism.
missing_from_theories.how_to_add: Create a multi-stage progression system with different participation levels and transition rates between them

new_variables.name: Peripheral Participants
new_variables.description: Newcomers observing and doing simple tasks

new_variables.name: Active Participants
new_variables.description: Regular contributors not yet core members

new_variables.name: Progression Rate Peripheral to Active
new_variables.description: Flow from peripheral to active participation

new_variables.name: Progression Rate Active to Core
new_variables.description: Flow from active to core developer status

new_variables.name: Legitimacy of Peripheral Tasks
new_variables.description: Availability of appropriate tasks for newcomers

new_connections.rationale: Better peripheral tasks accelerate learning and progression
Effective mentoring speeds up core member development
Good documentation enables better peripheral task design

expected_loops.description: More core developers → Better mentoring → Faster progression → More core developers
Limited mentoring capacity constrains progression rates

missing_from_theories.expected_impact: Will capture the gradual learning and progression dynamics, showing how community structure affects newcomer retention and core developer pipeline

missing_from_theories.why_important: The social fabric and shared resources that bind the community together, affecting knowledge sharing and collaboration effectiveness
missing_from_theories.how_to_add: Model social capital and shared resources as stocks that affect collaboration and knowledge transfer

new_variables.name: Community Social Capital
new_variables.description: Trust, relationships, and shared understanding

new_variables.name: Shared Repertoire
new_variables.description: Shared tools, stories, ways of doing things

new_variables.name: Social Capital Depreciation
new_variables.description: Natural decay of social connections

new_variables.name: Collaboration Effectiveness
new_variables.description: How effectively community members work together

new_connections.rationale: Better shared repertoire enables better knowledge documentation
Core developers build and maintain social capital

expected_loops.description: More collaboration → Better social capital → Better collaboration
Community growth dilutes social capital if not maintained

missing_from_theories.expected_impact: Will capture how social dynamics and shared resources affect knowledge sharing efficiency and community cohesion

missing_from_theories.why_important: The process where explicit knowledge becomes tacit through learning and practice, crucial for skill development and expertise building
missing_from_theories.how_to_add: Add internalization as a flow from explicit to tacit knowledge, influenced by practice opportunities

new_variables.name: Community Tacit Knowledge
new_variables.description: Unexpressed knowledge, skills, and intuition

new_variables.name: Knowledge Internalization Rate
new_variables.description: Conversion of explicit to tacit knowledge through practice

new_variables.name: Practice Opportunities
new_variables.description: Availability of tasks for applying learned knowledge

new_variables.name: Individual Skill Level
new_variables.description: Average skill level of contributors

new_connections.rationale: More explicit knowledge enables more internalization

expected_loops.description: More explicit knowledge → More internalization → Higher skills → Better knowledge creation → More explicit knowledge

missing_from_theories.expected_impact: Will capture how learning and skill development occur through practice, affecting problem-solving capacity and innovation

missing_from_theories.why_important: The physical, virtual, and mental spaces that enable knowledge creation. In OSS, this includes communication platforms, norms, and psychological safety
missing_from_theories.how_to_add: Model the enabling environment for knowledge creation as a mediating variable

new_variables.name: Knowledge Creation Context Quality
new_variables.description: Quality of platforms, norms, and environment for knowledge sharing

new_variables.name: Psychological Safety
new_variables.description: Perceived safety to ask questions and share ideas

new_variables.name: Communication Platform Effectiveness
new_variables.description: Quality of tools for collaboration

new_connections.rationale: Better context enables better knowledge sharing
Good context supports learning and practice

expected_loops.description: Better context → More knowledge sharing → Stronger community → Better context

missing_from_theories.expected_impact: Will capture how the enabling environment affects all knowledge processes, showing infrastructure and cultural impacts on community effectiveness

missing_from_theories.why_important: How knowledge flows across community boundaries and how brokers connect different communities, crucial for innovation and avoiding insularity
missing_from_theories.how_to_add: Add variables for cross-community interactions and knowledge brokering

new_variables.name: External Knowledge Inflow
new_variables.description: Knowledge entering from other communities

new_variables.name: Boundary Spanning Activity
new_variables.description: Level of interaction with external communities

new_variables.name: Knowledge Brokers
new_variables.description: Members who connect multiple communities

new_variables.name: Innovation Rate
new_variables.description: Rate of novel solutions and approaches

new_connections.rationale: More boundary activity brings more external knowledge
External knowledge enriches project knowledge base

expected_loops.description: More boundary activity → More innovation → Project attractiveness → More boundary activity

missing_from_theories.expected_impact: Will capture how cross-community interactions drive innovation and prevent knowledge stagnation

general_improvements.implementation: Add knowledge depreciation flows for both explicit and tacit knowledge, influenced by technology change rate

general_improvements.description: Differentiate between different types of knowledge (technical, social, process)
general_improvements.implementation: Split knowledge stocks into technical knowledge, social knowledge, and process knowledge with different dynamics

general_improvements.description: Add feedback between community size and coordination overhead
general_improvements.implementation: Add coordination complexity variable that increases with community size, negatively affecting collaboration effectiveness
Add auxiliary variables for academic calendars, conference seasons, or holiday periods affecting contribution rates

general_improvements.description: Distinguish between different types of issues (bugs, features, documentation)
general_improvements.implementation: Split issues into categories with different resolution dynamics and skill requirements
